newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Cholera outbreak in Venezuela said under control.
newsitem.headline: Cholera outbreak in Venezuela said under control.

text.p: A cholera outbreak in Venezuela has killed 23 people in the past three months but is now virtually under control, health authorities said on Saturday.
Nearly all the deaths and 434 of the 592 confirmed cases occurred in western Zulia state bordering Colombia, the Health Ministry's Epidemic Watch Unit said in a report.
During the past week only three new cases were reported and authorities said the epidemic was no longer spreading.
Cholera, spread by poor hygiene or the contamination of drinking water by sewage, causes severe diarrhoea and dehydration.
